title: About Me
description: Learn more about my journey, skills, and what inspires me as a designer and developer.
content:
<Image src="/images/about/selfie.jpg" alt="Saksham Tandon" width={400} height={200} className="!rounded-full w-64 h-64 mb-4" />

# üëã Hi, I‚Äôm Saksham Tandon

I am a versatile and passionate digital designer, scientific illustrator, and software engineer, with a BA in Global Business and Digital Arts from the University of Waterloo and a Diploma in Software Engineering from BrainStation.

I have also completed a certificate in Data Science and am currently pursuing a MicroMasters in Data Science (MITx) on eDX platform, further expanding my expertise.

At CDW Canada, I specialize in creating engaging and responsive web banners, landing pages, and emails that adhere to brand standards and strategies. I conduct thorough user research and testing to enhance user experiences and drive conversion rates. A notable achievement includes contributing to a 193% increase in Research Hub article views and a 93% boost in partner page traffic through strategic content planning and implementation.

Additionally, as a Scientific Illustrator, I collaborate with researchers to produce illustrations and animations featured on covers and supplementary materials in scientific papers and journals. Notably, I designed a journal cover for Biophysical Journal showcasing the experimental setup and structure of pulmonary surfactants.

Having completed my Software Engineering Bootcamp at BrainStation, where I gained proficiency in coding and web application development, I am now expanding my expertise in data science. I am currently learning Python for data analysis, machine learning techniques, and data visualization. This knowledge empowers me to integrate statistical analysis and predictive modeling into innovative digital solutions.

***

## üé® What I Do

* **UX & UI Design** ‚Äì Intuitive and accessible digital products.
* **Motion Design** ‚Äì Animation that clarifies and captivates.
* **Scientific Illustration** ‚Äì Visual storytelling for research and science.
* **Front-End Development** ‚Äì Building fast, responsive web experiences with modern tools.

***

## üíº Experience

### üß© Associate Designer

**CDW Canada** ¬∑ Full-time ¬∑ *Remote*\
üìÖ Jan 2022 - Present

Designs static and animated digital/web banners for desktop and mobile.\
Develops and maintains CDW.ca landing pages and emails aligned with brand standards.\
Translates strategic goals into cohesive, responsive digital designs using industry tools.

**Highlights:**

* Achieved a **193% YoY increase** in Research Hub article views
* Boosted partner page traffic by **93%** through strategic content planning

### Scientific Illustrator

**Freelance** ¬∑ Remote\
üìÖ Sep 2020 - Present

* Designed the cover for the prestigious Biophysical journal.
* Produced drawings and illustrations to enhance scientific papers and presentations.
* Conducted comprehensive research on scientific papers, gaining a deep understanding of theories and core concepts behind experiments and results.

***

## üß† My Philosophy

> ‚ÄúDesign is empathy in action. The best experiences are felt, not just seen.‚Äù

I blend creativity with logic, and research with intuition‚Äîdesigning solutions that are not just usable, but meaningful.

***

## üß¨ My Journey

* üéì BA in **Global Business and Digital Arts** (University of Waterloo)
* üß™ Created journal cover art and scientific illustrations for research publications
* üíª Completed a **Software Engineering Bootcamp** at BrainStation
* üìä Currently pursuing a **MicroMasters in Data Science** through MITx

***

## Decision Tree

Decision trees illustrate choices and possible outcomes, making them ideal for decision-making workflows or processes involving multiple paths.

## Entity-Relationship Diagram

Entity-relationship diagrams (ERDs) are used to model relationships between entities in a system. They are widely used in database design and system architecture planning.

title: Filetree
description: This section provides an overview of file structures and their implementation using the FileTree component.
content:
This section demonstrates the structure of a file tree using the `FileTree` component. Below is an example showcasing folders and files organized hierarchically for a project setup.

## How to Use

Integrate the `FileTree` component into your project to visually represent file and folder structures. This is particularly useful for documentation, tutorials, or providing users with an overview of your project's architecture.

### JSX Code Example

Here is how you can define the file tree structure in for use in your project:

```jsx
<FileTree>
  <Folder name="src" label="Source Code">
    <File name="index.tsx" label="Index File" />
    <Folder name="components" label="Components">
      <File name="button.tsx" label="Button Component" />
      <File name="input.tsx" label="Input Component" />
    </Folder>
    <Folder name="pages" label="Pages">
      <File name="home.tsx" label="Home Page" />
      <File name="about.tsx" label="About Page" />
    </Folder>
  </Folder>
</FileTree>
```

Use this code as a template to set up your own file tree structure and customize it as needed.

title: Bounce Back Coin Branding
description: Bounce Back Coin lets users earn cryptocurrency through learning. I designed the logo, branding guidelines, and website.
content:
## ‚ú® Introduction Welcome to the Bounce Back Coin Branding Design Showcase. Bounce Back Coin is a learning platform that lets users earn cryptocurrency by participating in educational activities. Our goal is to make learning fun and rewarding. As the designer for Bounce Back Coin, I created the logo and branding guidelines to ensure a consistent look and feel. I also designed the marketing website. ## üîç Research and Analysis The logo design process began with brainstorming concepts related to bouncing and growth, as seen in the sketches exploring shapes and movements. These ideas were refined into a cohesive design that symbolizes learning and reward, encapsulating the essence of Bounce Back Coin. ### Logo Mark Ideas ### Direction #1 - Playful Gradients, minimalist while being engaging.
Idea Mood Board
### Direction #2 - Pure minimalist, simple with flat colors.
Idea Mood Board
### Direction #3 - Mix of both styles. ## üé® Final Style Guide The team decided to move forward with the second design direction, selecting the "B" logo mark for its simplicity and relevance. Building on this choice, I developed a comprehensive style guide to establish a strong foundation for the brand's visual identity. ## üíª Website Design Mockup
Desktop Design
Mobile Design
## üì± Some Social Media Assets ### Instagram Post Carousel ### Addition of Patterns To honor the heritage of the founders, I incorporated cultural patterns inspired by African and Caribbean traditions into the design, subtly weaving a rich tapestry of heritage into the brand's visual identity. I carefully melded these cultural elements with geometric shapes, ensuring a harmonious blend that enhances the existing design aesthetic.
Mood Board - Cultural Patterns
Mood Board - Geometric Patterns

title: Bounce Back Digital Branding
description: Showcasing branding guidelines and marketing assets for Bounce Back Digital, a digital agency/fintech startup.
content:
## ‚ú® Introduction

Bounce Back Digital, parent company of Bounce Back Coin, is a digital agency and fintech startup that focuses on providing innovative solutions in the digital space. The branding project aimed to create a cohesive visual identity that reflects the company's mission and values.

## üî∑ Logomark

Designed by Samridh Arora, designed to convey a sense of professionalism and multi-faceted services. The logomark is a stylized representation of the letter "B" and "D" on an isometric cube to represent the brand name "Bounce Back Digital".

Samridh Arora on [Linkedin](https://www.linkedin.com/in/samridharora42/).

<ImageViewer imageUrl="/images/bb-digital-branding/logo-mark.png" alt="Logomark" width={800} height={400} />

## üîç Research

### Direction #1 - Light Hearted, Minimalist with Stroke Outlines

A playful exploration of the branding with a modified logomark to align with [Bounce Back Coin's branding](/docs/recent-work/bounce-back-coin-branding).

<ImageViewer imageUrl="/images/bb-digital-branding/style-scape-1.png" alt="Stylescapes" width={800} height={400} />

### Direction #2 - Professional, Gradients, Wireframe, Bold

<ImageViewer imageUrl="/images/bb-digital-branding/style-scape-2.png" alt="Stylescapes" width={800} height={400} />

## ‚úÖ Final Branding

For the final branding, we decided to go with the second design direction, which was more professional and aligned with the company's vision. After a few changes like removing the green color and switching to a more blueish color palette, we finalized the branding.

## üí° The Idea

This project came about through participation in the RSA Design Awards. We had to create a product from a selection of briefs.

## üìù Our Brief:

**Redistributing Health**\
*How might we design systems that provide seamless and cost-effective access to quality health services for underserved communities?*

## üéØ Our Focusing Themes:

## üì± About the App

The main idea of the application was to create a service that gave users access to a **library of games focused on mental wellness**.

## üîç User Research

Based on our research, it was clear that COVID-19 created significant barriers that hinder people from getting the care they need.\
The **scarcity of mental health resources** made it harder to help these groups of people, resulting in:

* Bottling up emotions
* Spontaneous outbursts
* Worsening unhealthy coping mechanisms

## üìä Main Trends

* Rise in screen time and gaming practices
* Video games were found to be stress-relieving
* Scientific research showed games were effective in managing mental health

## üë§ User Personas
